channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Mexico City's water woes aren't going away with the arrival of rains
item.description: It's rainy season in Mexico City, some streets are flooded and yet for many the taps are still dry.
item.content:encoded: It's rainy season in Mexico City, some streets are flooded and yet for many the taps are still dry.
item.dc:creator: Emily Green

item.title: Astronomers spot a mysterious black hole nestled in a cluster of stars
item.description: A report from Nature shows that astronomers may have found a medium-sized black hole, a kind they've long looked for.
item.content:encoded: A report from Nature shows that astronomers may have found a medium-sized black hole, a kind they've long looked for.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Extreme temperatures are impacting rescue helicopters in California
item.description: Extreme temperatures cause big problems for rescue helicopters. NPR's Scott Simon talks with Douglas Evans, a rescue pilot in California, about conditions in his state.
item.content:encoded: Extreme temperatures cause big problems for rescue helicopters. NPR's Scott Simon talks with Douglas Evans, a rescue pilot in California, about conditions in his state.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Week in politics: Biden tries to redeem debate performance at press conference
item.description: President Biden gave a strong performance at a news conference this past week but continues to face calls from fellow Democrats to end his re-election bid.
item.content:encoded: President Biden gave a strong performance at a news conference this past week but continues to face calls from fellow Democrats to end his re-election bid.
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Saturday Sports: Wimbledon, Major League Baseball
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon talks to Howard Bryant of Meadowlark Media about the Wimbledon Championship tennis finals and about Major League Baseball as it reaches the midseason mark.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon talks to Howard Bryant of Meadowlark Media about the Wimbledon Championship tennis finals and about Major League Baseball as it reaches the midseason mark.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The newest lifeguards at a Maine beach are drawing attention
item.description: When it comes to water safety, lifeguards are key but also life ... dogs? NPR's Scott Simon talks to Greg Wilfert, of Maine's Scarborough Beach State Park about some new members of his staff.
item.content:encoded: When it comes to water safety, lifeguards are key but also life ... dogs? NPR's Scott Simon talks to Greg Wilfert, of Maine's Scarborough Beach State Park about some new members of his staff.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: U.S. officials warn of Russia's sabotage operations in Europe
item.description: NPR’s Scott Simon speaks with national security expert, Andrea Kendall-Taylor, after officials warn that Russia is stepping up a campaign of covert sabotage across Europe.
item.content:encoded: NPR’s Scott Simon speaks with national security expert, Andrea Kendall-Taylor, after officials warn that Russia is stepping up a campaign of covert sabotage across Europe.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: How one woman moved from a domestic violence shelter to a home of her own
item.description: In our second installment of our moving series, Katie Laura found a new apartment in Milwaukee for herself and her children after spending a month in a domestic violence shelter.
item.content:encoded: In our second installment of our moving series, Katie Laura found a new apartment in Milwaukee for herself and her children after spending a month in a domestic violence shelter.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: A day in the life of a baseball 'clubbie'
item.description: Behind every major league ball team are a set of fast-moving men and women who make sure the game runs smoothly.
item.content:encoded: Behind every major league ball team are a set of fast-moving men and women who make sure the game runs smoothly.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: Looking back at Wisconsin's long history with the Republican Party
item.description: The Republican Party was born in Ripon, Wis., about 90 minutes northwest of Milwaukee. As the state prepares to host the Republican National Convention, we revisit the party's roots.
item.content:encoded: The Republican Party was born in Ripon, Wis., about 90 minutes northwest of Milwaukee. As the state prepares to host the Republican National Convention, we revisit the party's roots.
item.dc:creator: Chuck Quirmbach
